pr_title: Issue #8934: FinalLocalVariable throws a NPE on Switch expression in assignment

timeline.message: Issue #8934: FinalLocalVariable throws a NPE on Switch expression in assignment
Issue #8934: FinalLocalVariable throws a NPE on Switch expression in assignment
Issue #8934: FinalLocalVariable throws a NPE on Switch expression in assignment
Issue #8934: FinalLocalVariable throws a NPE on Switch expression in assignment
Issue #8934: FinalLocalVariable throws a NPE on Switch expression in assignment

timeline.bodyText: Please move new code block to the end of file so you will not have this change
timeline.author: romani

timeline.bodyText: Please extend Input for default config
timeline.author: romani

replies.bodyText: Sorry, I don't understand what you mean. Could you please explain?
replies.author: anhminhtran235

replies.bodyText:
if you pay attention to comment above class you will see that there is definition of Check config.
your bug is for default config of Check, without any modification in properties.
please create https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/tree/master/src/test/resources-noncompilable/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/coding/finallocalvariable
new file InputFinalLocalVariableCheckDefaultSwitchExpressions.java and use it for default config configuration., so new UT method should be created to use new file.
replies.author: romani

replies.bodyText:
@romani this is the default config; during summer I thought that it might be a good idea to list the config regardless of whether it is default or not, which is why this file doesn't say default.  At some point in the future, the default could change, and then we would have to either update configs at the top of the input files or ...
I do agree that a new input and UT should be created.
replies.author: nmancus1

replies.bodyText:
new file InputFinalLocalVariableCheckDefaultSwitchExpressions.java

Since the existing input has no switch expressions on RHS of variable definition, we could just call it  InputFinalLocalVariableCheckSwitchAssignment.java or something.
replies.author: nmancus1

replies.bodyText:
default config should be /* Config: default
definition of default is useful during review agree, I really hope one day we will convert UTs to be aligned with BDD concepts. It is project for future GSoCs.
and all this nuances in comments will be auto validated.
replies.author: romani

replies.bodyText: fixed. I have added a separate UT, as well as InputFinalLocalVariableCheckSwitchAssignment.java. Thank you for your guidance.
replies.author: anhminhtran235

timeline.message: Issue #8934: FinalLocalVariable throws a NPE on Switch expression in assignment

Issue #8934: FinalLocalVariable throws a NPE on Switch expression in assignment

timeline.bodyText:
As @romani stated in his items, please create a new UT and input file.  It would be good to show:

violations: definitions where variable is not declared final but is never reassigned
acceptable variable definitions (those that are declared final and never reassigned)
acceptable variable definitions (where the variable is not declared final AND is reassigned).

...  where a switch expression is on RHS of the assignment.   Try to put the code within methods, class blocks, constructors, even nested switch expressions, etc. to make sure that we can successfully check all.
timeline.author: nmancus1

replies.bodyText: You're welcome @nmancus1. I have created a new UT and a new input file with violations and acceptable cases. I've also put a switch expression on RHS of the assignment,... like you suggested
replies.author: anhminhtran235

timeline.bodyText: @anhminhtran235 please make this as separate commit, such as minor: fix indentation since this was not related to #8934. Some GSOC student must've missed this over the summer :)
timeline.author: nmancus1

replies.bodyText: So should it be in this same PR, or in a different PR? I guess it should be in a different PR since there can only be 1 commit in a PR?
replies.author: anhminhtran235

replies.bodyText:
So should it be in this same PR, or in a different PR?

In this PR, please. It is ok for a minor commit such as this that doesn't affect functionality.  Thanks for double checking, you are right, it is always a good practice to keep functional changes in separate issues/PRs.
replies.author: nmancus1

replies.bodyText: I see. I just added a minor commit to fix indentation
replies.author: anhminhtran235

replies.bodyText: @anhminhtran235 I forgot:  to pass Travis you will likely need to make it minor: fix indentation(#8934), since one of our CI jobs tests for an issue number in your commits.  Thanks a lot.
replies.author: nmancus1
